Comments

They have campus security,cameras are everywhere you look.I heard from current student of stealing and vehicle Break-Ins.Also heard of students having tools stolen and that the school wouldn't replace.Now remember this was hearsay and i don't know the entire story and couldn't verify it.I was also told that campus security was bad to write tickets and take it out of your student loan money,this could be an issue.
Unknown,I'll write once i get there and update this.
Unknown,I'll write once i get there and update this.
Hands on learning, If your lazy and immature don't waste your time, these instructors will give you everything you need and more.
Unknown,I'll write once i get there and update this.
Seems overpriced, but you get what you pay for. I myself will be in debt 30 grand after i graduate. You won't find many schools that has hands on like this school.
Hey it's Nashville and you'll have plenty to do in your spare time.

The one thing i didn't get to see was the cafeteria.That is still a mystery until i start.I received mixed reviews from various students and can't give an opinion yet. I know they serve three meals a day.
Dorms are small,your allowed a dorm fridge and microwave.Housing services can help you with a place off campus also.

Most of your learning will be hands on,some classroom but the majority will require you to get your hands dirty.Alot of students are working either full or part time jobs,so you have the option of going to Day or Night classes to work around your schedule.

Go to the open house ,meet the instructors and tour the entire campus.Ask questions and you'll get answers.I spoke with current students away from staff and most talked highly of this school.Your required to purchase a tool set,they offer a Napa brand set for about a $1000 or you can go with Snap On for a few hundred more.

I went to the NADC in Nashville,Tn to meet the instructors and got the grand tour of what they had to offer.If your a hands on type of person you will love what they offer when compared to the competition.I got my acceptance letter in June and will be starting in August 2014.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Melissa from East Haven, CT 03/10/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 4 of 20 Categories Comments Great for these types of students i think lcne is great for many different types of students. the non traditional adult student would benefit greatly from smaller class sizes after being out of school for so long. also i think students who may not have the best self discipline would be great here because the professors and staff at lcne truely want every student to succeed. Bang for the buck i think the school does offer a good bang for your buck. included in your tuition is a learning center and free tutoring which is open to all students who may need a little extra help. with the small class sizes you're really able to get that one on one support which for me made lcne more appealing. What to do for fun
